page.title: 09VISITS TO FARMS.
page.content: We went to one of the fifteen farms in our block. It is called Northfield Farm. The farm has 86 acres. The land is used partly for growing hay for the horses and partly for grazing. There are 45 horses on the farm. The biggest horse measuring 17.2 hands. The farm has 12 workers on it. They have the following machines on the farm:- tractors, rotavators and baler. They only send manure to market. There is a riding school at Northfield Farm. Maypole Farm is 70 acres and the land is used for barley, potatoes, hay and oats. They have cattle on the farm. The Corn Merchant comes to collect corn and they take the cattle to market.
